alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:14PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Hennepin, Dakota and Carver Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers. Additional rainfall from today and into Friday will keep river flows increased. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 710.5 feet, Flood waters begin to back up Eagle Creek and block the Highway 101 Frontage Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 706.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Thursday was 706.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 708.6 feet next Thursday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 708.4 feet on 06/29/1957. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
